intro: Thlaspi ferganense, commonly known as the Fergana cabbages, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It features basal rosettes of leaves and produces small, white or yellow flowers. Thlaspi ferganense is valued for its ornamental potential and has been studied for its potential in phytoremediation due to its ability to accumulate heavy metals.
